SENT.plain: OBJECTIVES: Review of venous lesions in Behçet's disease (BD)
MATERIALS AND METHODS: One hundred and twenty nine patients with BD diagnosed and treated in our hospital during the last 10 years were reviewed
Fifty-two patients with 54 vascular lesions of Behçet's disease were identified
MAIN RESULTS: The incidence of isolated venous lesions in BD was 26%
Venous lesions developed after the initial diagnosis of BD in all patients within 10 years
Thirty-four (63%) of the 54 vascular lesions were venous and 15 (28%) were arterial
In 5 (9%) patients, both arterial and venous lesions were present

Deep vein thrombosis was the most frequent lesion (76%), followed by superficial thrombophlebitis (10%), superior vena cava thrombosis (10%) and inferior vena cava thrombosis (2%) and varicose veins (2%)
CONCLUSIONS: Venous lesions are not rare and affect the prognosis of BD
For this reason, venous lesions of BD should always be sought at follow-up of patients with BD
